Title: Friday the 13th Part VIII: Jason Takes Manhattan
Author: Rob Hedden

Replies.Reply: I'm talking about graduation. Being totally free to do whatever we want now.
Gotta throw the anchor over.
glances at the lake, at their eerie surroundings. He feels a chill, heading back inside.
Nothing.
It's just that we're right around that old summer camp where all those murders took place.
Never mind, you don't want to know about it.
Let's drop it, okay?
None of the counselors heard him.
A bunch of years went by and everybody forgot about it.
That's when the murders started.
His mother blamed the counselors for his death and tried to kill them all.
She got her head chopped off by one of them.
No.
And every now and then, the murders start up again.  The boat lurches slightly, tugging at the anchor cable. She's scared: he's frightened himself a little, too.
Forget about it, Suzy. They're just stories.
Right.
Right.
Right. Except that Jason isn't real so none of it matters anyway.
Hear what?
All right, I'll check it out.
Gotcha good, baby cakes.
All right, all right -- I'm a major ass.
And I'll never do it again. Forgive me?
Uh-huh. You must really think I'm an ass.
Ask me in about five minutes.
It feels excellent.
What's wrong?
C'mon, Jimmy. Something's bothering you.
What murders?
Tell me.
What stories?
So the murders stopped?
We're the last graduating class, right?  Jim's kissing her body, putting Jason behind him.
I mean, Lakeview High just closed its doors for good, right?
Did you hear that?
C'mon, I'm serious.
stands there in speechless shock, looking down at her mortal wound. But there's no blood.
And you'll never do it again.
No.
lets out a broad smile, her eyelids fluttering. They stay open long enough to regard the visitor in the doorway. She tries to choke out a warning to Jim, who's just collapsed himself.
Eight year old JASON is desperately trying to tread water, flailing his arms like a marionette to get attention as he gulps down gallons of mossy lake water.
as MRS. VOORHEES comes directly at camera wielding a huge knife and a primal scream.
grabs her hand, pulling hard, then grinning wide.
leaps out, clutching a HUGE KNIFE. Suzy barely has time to scream before JASON PLUNGES THE KNIFE INTO HER CHEST.
pulls the knife back out, pushing the blade in and out with his hand. It's a retractable rubber knife. JIM pulls off the hockey mask with a huge grin, tossing it aside.
raises the spear, taking aim.
emerging from a cloud of vapor like her worst nightmare.
swings the guitar downward and buries it in J.J.'s skull.

holding the opposite end of the harpoon. He shoves it forward with one more staccato jerk and:  CLOSE UP - CHIEF ENGINEER'S BACK  -- The harpoon's bloody, corroded tip pierces through his once-white uniform.
hovering over him, now clutching one of the scaling knives.
appears on the corridor steps for a brief second. The spotlight goes black, then flashes on again. Now he's gone.
illuminates only ten feet from her, a crimson strobe assaulting his hockey mask. She's on a collision course with him.
rapidly moving down the staircase towards them. Sean's view is CUT OFF as the lifeboat sinks below deck level.
standing by the hoist, hovering over the edge. Very angry.
looks at it long and hard. He tears off his life preserver wits renewed ambition.
appears at the parking lot stairs, STALKING STRAIGHT TOWARDS THE CAR.
heaves the dog in front of the train.
trips backwards and LANDS ON THE THIRD, ELECTRIFIED RAIL, RECEIVING TEN THOUSAND VOLTS. His body smokes and convulses, finally sizzling out. He appears to be terminated!!!

shoves his way through the preoccupied pedestrians; they've certainly seen weirder characters than him here. He moves past a group of STREET URCHINS listening to some rap from their ghetto blaster. His foot obliterates their stereo system with one stride. They instantly pull out switchblades and chains.
lifts the very large man and EFFORTLESSLY HEAVES HIM INTO THE MIRROR OVER THE COUNTER.
has been sufficiently taunted. He moves after her.
vision or no vision, he is lurching towards her relentlessly. She is literally sandwiched between hell and high water.
within ten feet of them, shifting directly for the ladder like he's working on some kind of radar.
Tons of lethal sewage, stopping for no one. Arriving in seconds.
Remember girls, the shuffleboard tournament will start at six p.m. sharp. A non-attendance will restrict your time in port, understood?
Your itinerary has been carefully planned and make no mistake, it will be executed accordingly.
Rennie's not coming.
She changed her mind.
You can stop right there, Miss Mason.
It's already been done.
Congratulations on the 3.9 average, Miss Watanabe. You're in stateroom two-
All right. But if it mysteriously disappears en route, I'll have you sent back home the minute we dock. Understood?
Jim Miller and Suzy Donaldson never showed up. I'm a little concerned.
Let's go -- we're running two minutes late.
She doesn't know what she wants. She's never had a stable life.
I'm her legal guardian, not you or anybody else, and I alone know what's best for her. End of discussion.
Your father was looking for you, Mr. Robertson.
There's a storm predicted tonight.  Rennie looks at the ocean, forcing herself not to turn away.
You're making a big mistake, Rennie. It's not too late to put you back on land.
Why are you doing this to yourself?
Facing your fear doesn't always conquer it.
Have you seen my niece anywhere?
Senior predictions started five minutes ago and she hasn't shown up.
In your case I'm sure that's true.
What are you doing in here?
Are you girls using drugs?
I'11 be coming around your stateroom in exactly fifteen minutes, Miss Mason. You'd better have your biology project ready or I'm phoning your parents.
Then I'll make sure you remain on board while your classmates see the sights.
Oh, I can see that. You've done a wonderful job of supervising the kids, Miss Van Deusen.
I'm in no mood for any more stall tactics, Miss Mason. Where is your final project?
Where did you get that alcohol?
That's it. You're not setting foot off this ship until we return home.
Oh, you've done it now. Not only are you going home, I'll see to it that you spend next year back in a high school classroom!
You'll never get away with it.
And you can forget about ever attending any film school.
You're both going to be very, very sorry.
I thought I told you to stay away from her.
Where's the radio?
What are you talking about?
It's no coincidence.
Walking corpses are not real!
You'll do no.such thing and watch your mouth, young man! I'm in charge here!
What?? You sent her out there with a murderer running around loose??
You had me worried to death!
I'm the one you should be listening to! Do you think dropping an anchor in the middle of a storm makes any sense whatsoever?
I refuse to discuss this ridiculous notion that a ghoul is terrorizing this ship.
This isn't a request.
She's locked safe in her room, no thanks to either of you.
He's the son of the Captain, for Chrissakes. You'd think he'd be able to operate this thing!
Well?
What's that?
Can you shut that damn thing off??
I doubt very much that one even exists.
Enough is enough.  He marches out the door. Sean finds the alarm kill switch, flipping it. The excruciating siren vanishes. He grabs a pair of rain jackets, tossing one to Miss Van Deusen.

almost flinches when the lights die and he's plunged into blackness. He moves forward, every step tentative. He passes the convection ovens and we REMAIN on them, spotting the frightened face of the DECK HAND in the shadows. The deranged old man is very sober now, clutching a LARGE KITCHEN KNIFE for defense.
Rennie??

cautiously steps up to the door, silently grabbing the knob and SWINGING IT OPEN. It's empty. He hears something, spinning around. Again, nothing is there. McCulloch quickly moves to the telephone and dials. A few seconds pass.
Come on, answer!!
What did you do with Rennie??
She never should've set foot on this ship. This is your fault!
Not another word, do you hear me??
Why aren't you with the others, woman??
Jason Voorhees is dead!!
Get in the boat, Rennie!
You can and you will!!
If we don't find the shore soon we're all going to die.
Come on -- everybody up the ladder.
A wonderful choice of places to dock a boat, Mr. Robertson.
You heard him! We have to call the police  Julius jerks away from McCulloch's grasp. But he knows McCulloch	is right.
Everyone split up -- we'll cover more ground that way.
My niece's life hangs in the balance right now!! Every second counts.
It's okay -- she's with me.
Don't be ridiculous!
Yes.
He's a walking corpse, a phantasm from hell.
Rennie, for God's sake slow down!!
Perfect for a swim, isn't it?
You've been coming out here every summer for the last three years, young lady, and you still haven't learned how.
That's what you said last year. I think the time for your first swimming lesson has just come.
You don't want to end up drowning like that Voorhees boy, do you?
He never learned how either and he's still at the bottom of this lake.
Oh, he is indeed. And ready to pull down anybody who falls in and can't swim.
Am I? Let's find out.
You can and you will! Swim, Rennie!
I was only trying to teach you. But I pulled you out, Rennie. I saved your life.
You're telling me this boat has a pool with a three meter board?
I think I'm gonna blow off New York and just stay on this thing.
Hey, Admiral Robertson. Love your ship.
You've really been generous to give us this cruise. I know I speak for everybody on board.
A half-twist short. I'll hone that dive yet.
Sean, what's going on?
Isn't there some international S.O.S. thing you can do???
I'll take the upper deck.
slips on a rung, regains control, and continues upward. He makes it three more steps, almost at the uppermost point when JASON GRABS THE BACK OF HIS COAT, TEARING HIM OFF THE MAST.
It's a ship and that's right. Plus a disco, gym, game room and a lot more.
Which cabin is Rennie in, Mr. McCulloch?
Be right up, Dad.
Hello, Dad.
Yeah, tell me about it.
I heard you weren't coming.
I got you a present.
Forget it. It's a dumb little thing anyway.
I thought maybe we could hike to the top of the Statue when we got there, if you felt like it. It's supposed to be 22 stories tall.
I guess I'll see you later.
What happened?
Rennie, are you okay?
realizes she's in trouble. He immediately dives in after her, pulling her to the pool's edge, where Miss Van Deusen helps to lift her out.
Me too.
Let's go talk to my Dad.
Not completing a voyage is against everything he stands for. But I think I can convince him to call a Coast Guard cutter for you.
If I go with you, he'll never speak to me again.
knocks on the bridge door. No answer. He's confused. He pushes the door open but something is blocking it. Sean puts his weight into it, shoving hard.

reaches out and swivels the chair around. It is his father BUT HIS THROAT HAS BEEN SLIT. Sean staggers backwards, uncomprehending, his senses overloaded. We MOVE with him until he's backed into Rennie, clutching onto him tightly.
God, I wish this was a joke, but it's not.
I didn't mean for you to go!
I've got the numbers.
Hello? Are you there??
I don't know.
We have to get everybody together just in case the fire's for real.
I don't know.
We'll be okay. I want you to wait by the lifeboats, just in case.
Water has gotten to the engines.
This is Jason's fault!
We have to get off this ship!!
Everybody in -- I'll get the hoists  McCulloch has no time for politeness, moving to the lifeboat ahead of the women. Rennie stops cold, gazing classy-eyed at the small boat.
Stop it!!
grabs an oar, turning back to McCulloch.
Start rowing!!
It's Julius!
We have to find the others.
Hey!
Jason's here in New York.
There aren't any handles!!
You keep away from her!
Not this time.

makes Rennie look away, dragging her with him along the platform edge in retreat as Jason returns his attention to them. They reach the end of the platform, having no choice but to board the front car.
It's over, Rennie. It's finally over.
Can you help us get out??
What do you mean?
I hear there's a statue here that's 22 stories tall.
Let's take in the brow.
She's a beauty, isn't she? I should've retired from the Navy ten years ago.
Hell, there's just twenty or so of you -- we only need a skeleton crew and it's a pleasure to sail her anyway.
By the way, congratulations on winning the intramural diving championships, Miles. I'm sure you made your old man proud.
Actually, I thought I'd leave the honors to my son.
Relinquishing command of the Princess Ruby to Captain Sean Robertson.
But before you take the helm, take this.
Something old and something new. I used the sextant when I was your age, but now they have these goddamn computers to do all the work for you.
Aren't you forgetting something?
We're in foggy weather! Send out the international maritime signal that a vessel is backing down, followed by a security broadcast warning other ships!
Let's kick in the stablilizers, Mr. Carlson, and get the seas off the quarter. These kids are in for one hell of a storm.
gets a reflective look in his weary eyes.
A tremendous age. Take some advice from a salty old man: don't push him too hard.
returns to the bridge as LIGHTNING flashes outside.
I'm glad you decided to come after all.
You let me worry about him, okay?
Personal experiences are what fuel the minds of great writers, Rennie. You made the right decision.
Everything okay?
Did you know that I'm giving up teaching?
Since the school is closing anyway, I'm going to write that novel I've been threatening on everybody.
A senior class cruise to Manhattan, laced with romance, adventure and murder.
Or a Gothic cook book. I haven't decided which.
Go on, open it.
Stephen King supposedly used it when he was in high school.
Hello, Charles. Has everyone checked in?
Don't be. They probably decided to explore each other rather than New York.
Charles, there's someone else coming along too.
And neither do you. It's up to Rennie to decide what she wants to do.
And she sure doesn't have one now, either. She needs to live.
No, I think it's just the beginning.
What's wrong, Rennie??
Poetry in motion, Miles.
No, but I'm sure Toby's fine. The ship's only so big and there's certainly no way off it, is there?
So, are you having fun yet?
I seem to detect a hint of ingenuousness in your tone.
In other words, level with me.
spins around, seeing Tamara standing there with Eva.
isn't looking at Rennie, her attention on admonishing Tamara.
Why on earth would you do something like that?
Bring her a towel, okay?
She's fine -- everybody go back to what you were doing.
Care to talk about it?
I gathered that.
I finally took lessons. I've never broken a bone since.
Maybe not. But you're not telling me everything, are you?
When did this start?
After your parents passed away?
Did you have an accident in the lake?
Only one young boy ever drowned in that lake, and that was before you were even born. His name was Jason Voorhees.
Where is she?
What are you doing??
But that doesn't prove that he's the one!
Please everybody, stay here!!
What was that??
What happens if we don't get control of the ship, Sean? I want you to tell me the truth.
Did you find Rennie?
He's doing the best he can, Charles.
What about the fire??
What are you talking about?
Everybody wait right here until I come back with the others -- understand?
Everybody climb in!
turns to see JASON APPROACHING THEM WITH AXE RAISED. She backs away but Jason ignores her, heading directly for the hoist. He arches back with his weapon and SLICES DOWNWARD.
sees it all, her intestines constricting in agonizing knots. She summons all her rationale and sends it down to her legs, running away as fast as she can.
Leave her alone, Charles!
Do you know where we are, Sean?
There must be a phone around here somewhere.
Is it true, Rennie??
I'm afraid you'll have some trouble believing us.
Thank you. The first thing we' have to do is find Julius.
Me too. But I'm not sure Uncle Charles will be.
What about not-so-great writers?
Just felt a little chill.
Really?
leans back in terror, falling into Miss Van Deusen.
I just got a little dizzy. I'm fine.

continues along the starboard side, not risking another glance overboard. She passes an older, very deranged DECK HAND, mopping the deck. HOLD on him, his bloodshot eyes following her like a crazed raven.
Hi, Sean.
We changed our minds.
I'd love to.
I'm staying.
She didn't push me into coming.
I don't even know why I'm afraid, Uncle Charles. I can't even remember when it started. Don't you think it's time I found out and got over it?
I'm staying.
I agree.
snaps out of it, moving to the door, where her dog is frantically clawing with his fur up.
appears from the shadows, just as startled to see them. It's not Jason at all. Rennie can't help noticing the cocaine, trying hard to ignore it.
Have you seen my dog? I think he came this way.
No thanks.
Toby?
Have you seen my dog anywhere?
flounders at the surface, nobody realizing the terror she's experiencing. She's too scared to even cry for help.
I can't swim.
It's not that simple.
Whenever I get near the water, I see this young boy drowning. He tries to pull me down with him.
No. It was just a normal summer. I've never been able to figure it out.
It wasn't her fault.
I want to go home. I want off this ship.
Can he really take us home?
What about you?
What is happening???
What do you mean???
Can't you call for help??
Where are they?
Just radio for help, okay???
Toby?
Toby? Where'd you go?
is oblivious as she reads the directions above the controls.
remains in the hoist box, making certain it is operating correctly. A second later, we see the fleeting outline of a HUMAN SHAPE appear behind her.
Can't we at least talk about it?
But what about the drowning boy I've been seeing?
I'm not staying in my room, Uncle Charles.
Uncle Charles!
stands frozen, feeling herself drawn to him like a magnet. She crawls to the edge of her rug, which is now a deep lake, and extends her arms to him.
feels the skin on her face crawling off her skull, her eyes expanding because she's now looking at:  HERSELF!
screams with guttural fear, letting go of herself, watching her younger self drown in the hole in her room.
What is it??
Is the ship going to sink??
I'm not going near any lifeboat!
I'm not!!
No!!!
No!
comes around the corner.
attention to her. She grabs a loose brick and FLINGS IT AT HIM, CRACKING HIS HOCKEY MASK, momentarily disorienting him. Rennie sprints away.
Then Jason came. He's here, Sean.
slams on the brakes, jerks it into reverse and FLOORS IT AGAIN.
desperately throws it into forward again, gripping the wheel and RACING FORWARD.
is too panicked to obey.
He was down there!!!
What's wrong, boy?
shrieks in horror as Toby disappears inside the pit just as the train roars by.
NO!!!
runs straight towards the track pit like a football punter, RECOILING WITH HER RIGHT LEG, KICKING JASON SQUARELY IN THE FACE.
Somebody help us!! He's going to kill us!!!
You don't understand -- there's a maniac trying to kill us!!!
Look!
tries to help up Sean but he's been knocked into the opposite wall, barely conscious.
backs away but does not run. The time has come to face her fears.
You never got me in the lake, Jason. And you're not going to get me now either.
drops the can, fumbling for the flashlight again.
Get up, Sean!!!
drags Sean to his feet with the strength of a possessed woman, pulling him over to a SERVICE LADDER attached to the intersecting alcove wall.
Climb!!!
Rennie's eyes show a hidden terror. She quickly turns away, shivering briefly. Miss Van Deusen notices. She turns a corner, heading into the parking lot.
as Rennie gets a hold of herself.
as McCulloch faces her, angrily grabbing Rennie's arms, shouting over the storm.
Jason methodically moves to the bank of switches, studying them.
as Sean's eyes dart around, down to the sea, up at the hoist.
as they move towards the stack of crates. Without warning, a PAIR OF GANG BANGERS JUMP OUT, BOTH HOLDING GUNS. Nervous young druggies.
her head back.
It's SEAN. He rushes to her, sensing her disorientation.
Hi, Mrs. Watanabe. Just kidding.
I hear the crew members are cute guys in their twenties.
It's my graduation gift from Daddy. It cost over a thousand bucks but it's the best.
More or less. It's part of my college fund.
What are you talking about?
Perfectly.
A major prick.
Improvise, of course.
Is that a muscular bod or what?
He's undefeated, you know that?
Julius is the only senior I'd even consider doing it with. If he wasn't black, that is.
My stepmom couldn't care less, but Daddy would have a shit fit.
He might even pay some attention to me.
Gorgeous guy at ten o'clock. Look sensual.
I think it's time for some recreational activity, girl.
You're joking, right?
The night time is the right time.  Tamara hands the straw to Eva.
You're talking to the prom queen, Eva. Do you really think I'm going to risk getting caught?
Do you realize how many people would kill to be sitting here right now? Come on, it's grad night. You've got your whole life to be uptight.
Is that unbelievable or what?
Jesus, you scared the hell out of us.
No, we haven't.
Care for a hit?
Nobody related to McCulloch can be nice.
Oh yeah. Ready to party and then some.
Nothing.
They're out of town.
That was truly excellent.
Time to check out the waiters.
Some friend you are.
The door's open.
Wouldn't you like a glass of champagne first, Charles?
I packed it. Just for us.
Take a closer look, Charles. I want to make sure I labeled all my organs correctly.
I don't think so, Mr. McCulloch.
Did you get anything good?
Relax, Wayne. He won't risk doing a thing.
Can I have the tape?
That's sweet, Wayne. Look, I'd love to chat but I'm really pressed for time.
Let's try to get together later, okey-
Thanks for the camerawork.
Don't worry about a thing, Mom. I'll have a terrific time and I won't do anything stupid, okay?
Really?
He bought you that?
She's telling the truth, Mr. McCulloch. I saw her pack it.
What are you going to do?
I'm not sure we're supposed to be here, Tamara.
My parents are open minded about that sort of thing.
No thanks.
It I get caught, I'll lose my science scholarship and everything.
I guess not.
I have her in Creative Writing and she's fairly nice.
Do you think I would use drugs, Mr. McCulloch? We were just exploring the ship.
What are you going to do?
Yeah.
I think I'll pass. See you later, okay?
Have you seen Tamara?
I don't care about being hip anymore.
Tamara? Are you around here anywhere?
Tamara?
Tamara?
I just want to talk with you.
whirls dizzily to the center of the dance floor upon the sight of him. Camera SPINS with her in 360 degree arcs, PUSHING IN on her face.
stops, looking everywhere.
Once they're out of Mrs. Watanabe's earshot --
You never turned in your final biology project, so I've had your diploma rescinded.
That's a very good question and I'd appreciate an answer.

Characters.Character: POINT OF VIEW OUT HOUSEBOAT WINDOW

Replies.Reply: The window is splattered with blood, but still clear enough to make out Tamara and Eva walking up the gangway, along with a half dozen other teenagers mingling on board.
Freeze.
floundering in the water. It takes us only a moment to recognize him -- IT'S YOUNG JASON. He's gasping, sucking in huge amounts of liquid, exactly like he did in the prologue.
Yes Sir.
Take in the gangway and single up all lines.
Have you decided on your departure protocol, Admiral?
Have you decided on a plan of departure, Captain?
Yes Sir. Activating comfort cruise mode.
Nineteen months.
This voyage is doomed.
He's come back and you're all going to die.
You're all going to die.
You're the last ones. He's come back for you.
Jason Voorhees.
He walks this ship, here and now.
You're the one who's insane!!
Too cool, J.J. Your parents came through.
She's sexy.
I'll catch you later.
Yeah, motivating downstairs, I think. What's the problem, Mr. McCulloch?
Some of us don't want our futures predicted.
who casually lowers his camcorder.
Oh yeah.
Wayne, you're an asshole.
Is the radio even working??
The Captain's been murdered. The buzz is that Jason might be on board.
No. And I'm not losing any sleep over it.
So what else is new?
Look Eva, you're asking the wrong dude to feel sorry for Tamara Mason. Wise up -- it's not hip to be her friend.
I'm sorry, but I've gotta find J.J.
What are you taking, Julius?
We're talking the possibility of Jason Voorhees here.
J.J. -- you down here?
lies helplessly on the metal grid work, realizing his bleak predicament has just been squared. He pulls himself to a standing position again.
We got a major problem, Wayne.
stands there, breathing some relief. He gets an idea, looking through his camcorder eyepiece. Wayne begins to adjust the eyepiece diaptor.
slowly lowers his camera as his heart rises into his throat.

screams, blindly running as fast as he can. He trips, picking himself up, stumbling down the catwalk stairs. Wayne makes it about ten feet before he stumbles over something, bringing with it a harsh strum from an ELECTRIC GUITAR.
as J.J. snaps the male end of the plug into the female. receptacle.
as Rennie's hand carefully dips it in India ink, moving to a blank page in her journal. She hesitates for several beats.
begins to bark vociferously, rushing to her cabin door, scratching to get out.
No water, no drowning boy.
as we come down a corridor, turning into the Service Area, stomping right up to Tamara and Eva. They both GASP; Tamara drops her mirror, which SHATTERS on the ground.
moving up to the bow door like Jason did before, cracking it open, seeing Rennie from behind. And moving towards her.
He's now within ten feet of the unaware girl.
Three feet from Rennie. She spins around to climb out of the hoist box and GASPS.
Somebody is creeping at a low angle towards them.
cautiously approaching them. Rennie stands, absolutely relieved.
quickly move on.

as Julius SLAMS PUNCH AFTER PUNCH INTO JASON, forcing him back to the center of the rooftop, spending every last ounce of his energy in doing so. He throws one more feeble punch, knowing it's his last.
How olds your boy now, Carlson?
moving closer and closer to the bridge door, having not the slightest inclination of what's in store for them.
Julius' severed head is resting on the dash board, staring back at them!!!
Jason lies dead on the asphalt. For about two seconds. He SLOWLY STANDS.
What the fuck is this?
Who did this, man?
Yeah, well these dead bodies are sure enough real.
I say we regroup and find this motherfucker before he finds us.  There's a murmur; it makes sense.
School's out, McCulloch.
Let's go.
I managed to scrounge this shit from the game room and hallways. Grab what you want.
Nothin'.
Nothin' but this gun.
Miles??
Hey man, if I can make it, so can. you.
Hey man, wake up! Check it out!!
God damn, we're in New York! You did it, my man!!
slams open the booth door, grabbing the receiver, punching the "operator" digit. SLOWLY PUSH IN on him as he waits for an answer. Several more rings.
This is Coast Guard cutter Dallas. What is the nature of your problem, Ruby?
The lights strobing across her face only accentuate her terror. She spots another door on a small stage, rushing to it. It's locked.

Thundering music. Frantic lights. And Jason and Eva at the center of it all. HER FEET ARE TWENTY-FOUR INCHES OFF THE GROUND, KICKING MADLY AS THE LIFE IS BEING CHOKED OUT OF HER. Finally Eva's legs go rag doll limp. Jason flings her to the ground like a sack of flour. This dance is over.
as a pair of SKEET RIFLES, three FIRE AXES, a FLARE GUN and several POOL CUES are dumped onto the foam padded plastic.

Characters.Character: POINT OF VIEW THROUGH GRID WORK

Replies.Reply: as Wayne inches forward. Camera slowly PANS INTO A PROFILE OF JASON, watching him from a catbird seat.
--sprawled out on the metal floor. He gropes around, his hands feeling something. It sends chills from his groin up through his scalp.
which shorts out with a fanfare of ELECTRICAL SPARKS AND FIRE, INSTANTLY FRYING WAYNE.

We PAN across them, stopping on one labeled "FIRE ALARM - DO NOT BREAK EXCEPT IN CASE OF EMERGENCY." Camera continues around to find we are in the POWER ROOM, NOT on the bridge. Our vision suddenly lands on JASON, staring at the alarm button, considering. He glances back over his shoulder.
as Sean flips the last toggle and a green light illuminates, indicating the AUTO PILOT is in effect.
There's only one person who needs to see it. And I'm going to find him.
Someone is spying on Miles from below, watching his every step.
He's scrambling as fast as he can across the slippery deck as the monster relentlessly pursues him.
flailing her arms in the water right next to the lifeboat, drowning.
What a beautiful day.
I'll take some lessons this time. I promise.
He is not.
You're telling a lie.
Her head is pulled taut against the wall just below the porthole, with Jason's hideous mask framed in the circular shattered window. She's slowly dying.
is SLAMMED OPEN FROM THE OTHER SIDE. She shrieks in terror but it's SEAN who is standing there.

Characters.Character: PONT OF VIEW FROM KITCHEN OVENS

Replies.Reply: Someone is crouched behind a massive convection oven, spying on McCulloch.
In large, unmistakable letters over a red button are the words "ABANDON SHIP ALARM." He flips back the plastic safety cover, exposing the button.
McCulloch gazes with utter disbelief.
as he relentlessly moves to the hoist cable, raising his axe.
He's just as quick, but smoother and more methodical.

as the walking corpse lifts a screaming McCulloch over his head, carrying him over to one of the scum-filled OIL DRUMS, SHOVING HIM HEAD-FIRST INTO IT. Jason grips McCulloch's thrashing legs as bubbles rise to the surface of the slime, a pathetic gurgling reverberating out the drum. At last McCulloch's appendages go limp. Jason releases him, moving on.
his compadre holding a squirming Rennie down on the couch, tearing back her jacket to reveal a bare arm.
She moves forward, the only sound being her shoes against wet asphalt. Four more steps, then a DARK, OUT OF FOCUS FIGURE STEPS OUT BEHIND HER WITH A GUN.
as they come forward at a brisk but cautious pace, strangers in a very strange land.
My apologies, Miss. My unit's right over here.
Is this the lass in question?
So try me.
You're right -- I find it a tall tale indeed. But you seem like honest folks so I'm inclined to believe at least some of it.
I'm sure he'll pop up soon enough. Why don't you climb in the back while I radio for backup.
--Rennie's terrified face filling it, seeing that Jason is in back of them.
look all around them, having never been to a city as big as this. They finally turn far enough around to spot JASON in a series of three quick cuts, each one closer than the last.
carefully sidestep it, continuing on. They make it another ten yards when A FIGURE LEAPS OUT FROM AN ALCOVE, GRIPPING A HUGE WRENCH. Rennie's scream echoes through the tunnel.
Hey!
You're dead meat, slime bag.
as Jason's mask comes off out-of-frame. Their tough faces turn to putty, scared completely shitless.
There's a pay phone in back.
Welcome to New York.
picks up the telephone, really pissed off.
stops in mid-dial. Fear is starting to register now.

feels the phone receiver slipping from her grasp, her mouth trembling. She backs away from the beast as far as she can. Jason has no time to waste on her, trampling out the back after Rennie and Sean as the other patrons shrink from him.

climbs off his counter stool, revealing a HUGE BOWIE KNIFE. Jason plows straight for him and the Biker STABS JASON IN THE HEART. Jason has little reaction, pulling it out, tossing it aside. The Biker's face goes wan, backing away.
What the hell are you kids doing down here?
I sure can and we don't have a minute to waste.
Toxic waste, son. This sewer floods out with the stuff on the 13th of every month, right at midnight.
And that's less than ten minutes from now.
Follow me.
rolls through the muck, its beam splashing erratically across the polluted walls.

Characters.Character: A GRUESOME SHADOW ON THE WALL

Replies.Reply: Jason arches his back with wrench in hand, hammering it over and over into the Sanitation Engineer's skull.
as the butt of the flashlight dents the metal, ultimately causing it to cave in.
The dim overhead lights are beginning to vibrate from the approaching flood.
